RT @orangebook_: People don't struggle to have real friends, they struggle to become a real friend.

They don't struggle to get happily marâ€¦

legacy.description: Thoughts triggering thoughts. Learning on the go. Novel in progress. Musing in Tokyo.

result.text:
People don't struggle to have real friends, they struggle to become a real friend.

They don't struggle to get happily married, they struggle to become happy alone.

They don't struggle to get opportunities, they struggle to become someone irreplaceable.

They don't struggle to understand the world with clarity, they struggle to understand their own mind with honesty.

Struggles to get what you want are actually struggles to become who you need to be.

legacy.full_text: Not having money and anyone you can rely on to get yourself out of that situation actually creates the circumstances needed to nurture mental strength and creativity. We are wired to take it easy as soon as we can. We are also wired to exceed our expectations as soon as we need.

legacy.description: Thoughts triggering thoughts. Learning on the go. Novel in progress. Musing in Tokyo.

result.text: The only mistake is to waste your time ruminating about your mistakes instead of learning from them and moving on. Frustrating mistakes should actually be a daily occurrence. They mean that you are still challenging yourself sufficiently, they mean you are still getting humbled by life as you should be, they mean you are still learning and growing unlike so many people past a certain age.

RT @orangebook_: You make more money when you already have money (people come to you with investment opportunities, you don't need to rushâ€¦

legacy.description: Thoughts triggering thoughts. Learning on the go. Novel in progress. Musing in Tokyo.

result.text:
You make more money when you already have money (people come to you with investment opportunities, you don't need to rush your decisions, you can invest with more patience.)

You save more time when you already have time (you can avoid rush hour, you can take your appointments during low-traffic periods, you think with more clarity and avoid time-consuming obvious mistakes.)

You attract more love when you are surrounded by love (you seem happy and confident, and that's the kind of person that everybody wants to hang out with.)  

You learn faster when you already learned a lot (you know how your mind works, you know how to not learn and how to deeply learn, you get straight to the point and choose what works for you.)

When it comes to building a great life, there is no shortcut, you invest in yourself until you are on the starting line, you keep going, and you eventually get what you deserve.
